statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Octavious Brown scored 13 points and grabbed eight rebounds as Alcorn State used a big first-half against Grambling State to post a 69-53 win to even its Southwestern Athletic Conference record M
article.headline: Alcorn State rolls past Grambling State for a 69-53 SWAC win
article.linkText: Alcorn State rolls past Grambling State for a 69-53 SWAC win
article.story: LOMAN, Miss. -- Octavious Brown scored 13 points and grabbed eight rebounds as Alcorn State used a big first-half against Grambling State to post a 69-53 win to even its Southwestern Athletic Conference record Monday night. The Braves opened the game on an 11-2 run and pushed their advantage to 15 points on Katumbusi Rahamanh's three-pointer with 6:15 to play in the first half. Alcorn State (4-11, 2-2 SWAC) took a 14-point advantage into intermission by knocking down 6 of 12 shots from beyond the arc in the opening 20 minutes. Tyrel Hunt scored nine of his 11 points in the first half. Ervin Mitchell finished with 12 points to lead Grambling State (5-11, 2-2). Nigel Ribeiro contributed 11 points. The Tigers managed just four offensive rebounds in the contest and got just two second-chance points.
